channel.title: Change and add links on Whonix Home Page for better UX
channel.description:
Hi everyone!
The following is my my proposal to a better UX [Home Page](http://www.kkkkkkkkkk63ava6.onion/wiki/Main_Page):
https://github.com/Whonix/Whonix-Website/pull/1
It contains two commits:
- Change wiki link appear in Home Page to /wiki/Documentation:
It was linking to [/wiki/Main_Page](http://www.kkkkkkkkkk63ava6.onion/wiki/Main_Page) but that page is not as useful as [/wiki/Documentation](http://www.kkkkkkkkkk63ava6.onion/wiki/Documentation). User has to click twice before reaching /wiki/Documentation, leaving some of them the wrong image that Whonix is not well documented. In addition, Main_Page can still easily be found in Documentation Page which seems not to be harmful to its accessibility.
- Add a News link on Home page which links to Whonix Blog
How do you like the proposal?
//cc @Ego

item.title: Change and add links on Whonix Home Page for better UX
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
iry:

make the whonix_main_page more attractive in whonix_document page, for example, by adding a “firsrt time visitor/user should know” as instructions.

That would point “first time Visitor/users” to the right place to start learning the basics about whonix. Personally I think “Whonix Overview” is a little vague for new users. I know when I first started using whonix I felt like the docs were a little intimidating and I really didn’t know where to start. It would definitely be helpful having “First Time Visitor/User Should Know” in the docs.

iry:

have an additional instruction on whonix_main_page saying something like “this wiki page is for fist time user/visitor,

That would work. It would have to be some where at the top of the page so you can see it as soon as the page loads. That way you can decide if you want to continue reading or move on to the wiki documentation page.

Both solutions would work but I’m kinda partial to the first one.

item.dc:creator: iry
item.description:
Hi @0brand !

Thank you very much for sharing your feedback!

0brand:

I think it is important for new users to read to get at least a little better understanding of how whonix works.

I understand.

I am thinking about two potential solutions:

  1. make the whonix_main_page more attractive in whonix_document page, for example, by adding a “firsrt time visitor/user should know” as instructions.

  2. have an additional instruction on whonix_main_page saying something like “this wiki page is for fist time user/visitor, for more detailed information on Whonix, please check: whonix_document”.

What do you think about that?!

item.title: Change and add links on Whonix Home Page for better UX
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Think it is a good idea to make navigation a little easier. The thing I like about the way it is set up now:

It links to the whonix_main_page (basic whonix overview) first so It would be more likely that a new / inexperienced user would read through it (main_page) before continuing on to the rest of the docs. I think it is important for new users to read to get at least a little better understanding of how whonix works.
